description:
At Revens, Revens & St. Pierre, we understand that the residents of Warwick, Rhode Island, and all across the state may need assistance with a variety of legal matters from time to time. You may find yourself facing a family law matter one week, needing advice regarding your business the next week or seeking guidance with a different legal issue at another time.

We realize that finding a law firm you feel comfortable working with isn't always an easy task, and many find it much more convenient to work with one law firm that can provide you with competent, consistent and compassionate service for nearly all your legal needs. For this reason, our team covers a wide variety of legal issues for its clients, including those in the following areas of law:

  • Business law
  • Estate planning
  • Elder law
  • Family law
  • Personal injury
  • Workers' compensation
  • Criminal defense
  • Real estate

You will receive no less than superior support and assistance from us, and the number of repeat clients we have attests to this fact. Our attorneys are AV Preeminent peer review-rated* by Martindale-Hubbell, which is its highest rating and speaks to the superior level of service we provide. What's more, our law firm has received numerous referrals from current and former clients who continue to come to us time and again when they need assistance.

We encourage you to experience everything we can offer for yourself by contacting Revens, Revens & St. Pierre to schedule your free initial consultation. Time is of the essence in many of these situations, so the sooner you reach out to us, the sooner you can gain peace of mind that your current legal issue and any future legal needs are in good hands.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
